channel.title: GWE Project News
channel.description: News and announcements of the GWE (Grid Wizard Enterprise) project

item.title: GWE 0.6.2.alpha Released
item.description:
GWE 0.6.2.alpha has been released. It is a maintenance release, which mainly includes robust security features to guarantee users' sensitive information (such as keystore and file system) is safe guarded using the latest security technologies, such as sandbox user environments, MD5 based symmetric keys and AES encryption. GWE terminal has been revamped as well with lots of inline editing friendly features. The complete list of changes for this release can be found in the <{{{changes-report.html}release notes}}> page.
The GWE daemon running on the <{{{cluster/birn.html}BIRN cluster}}> has been updated with this version, so if you have been interacting with this "GWE Enabled" cluster, you will need to update your previous GWE client installation. Check the <{{{guides/install.html#Updating}'Installation Guide'}}> for details on how to do such update.

item.title: GWE 0.6.1.alpha Featured at the NA-MIC's 2008 Engineering Review Week in Utah
item.description: GWE 0.6.1.alpha was featured at NA-MICs 2008 Engineering Review Week in Utah, to evaluate the value added created by integrating it with <{{{integration/slicer.html}3D Slicer3}}>. Useful feedback and feature requests (such as command pipelines) were collected.

item.title: Slicer Integration Draft Released
item.description:
GWE 0.6.1.alpha has been released bundled with a work-in-progress integration module to provide grid computing capabilities to <<{{{http://www.slicer.org/}3D Slicer}}>> by making accessible GWE features from within the Slicer UI. All the related details of this integration effort can be found in the <{{{integration/slicer.html}'GWE-Slicer Integration' page}}>.
Also, for those interested in getting updates on the progress of this particular effort, a <{{{mailto:gwe-slicer-users-subscribe@nbirn.net}slicer integration user's mailing list}}> has been made available.
P.S. As with any command line based process, Slicer module invocations can alternatively be parallelized with GWE by using its <{{{guides/user.html}generic tools}}>.

item.title: Collaboration Tools Enhancements
item.description:
The following tasks have been completed to ease project collaboration:
* Documentation (up-to-date with GWE 0.6.1.alpha release) all over the project site has been added and updated. A useful <{{{features.html}features page}}> have been created as part of it.
* The navigation of the project site has been revamped with a more self explanatory and cohesive sections.
* A <{{{changes-report.html}'Release Notes'}}> page has been created and will be used from now on to keep track of changes among release.
* A <{{{http://issues.nbirn.net/browse/GWE}'Issue Management System' (Jira)}}> has been allocated for the project to keep track of ALL new feature requests, defects, general tasks, etc.
* <{{{mail-lists.html}Mailing lists}}> have been created for general users and specialized integration users to distribute topic related announcements. The support mailing list is as always present for users to communicate back with the GWE team.
* A 'Source Code' section has been added for the user to allow the user to browse through <{{{xref/index.html}GWE's source code}}> and through different useful reports derived from it.
